meanings.definition: The mass or magnitude of something large.
meanings.sent1: The bulks of the mountains filled the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The bulks of the ships in the harbor were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The bulks of the clouds looked like fluffy pillows in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The bulks of knowledge in the library were waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The bulks of the elephants made them stand out in the savanna.

meanings.definition: To be large in size or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The food bulks in the pantry were enough for a feast.
meanings.sent2: His muscles bulks up after months of training.
meanings.sent3: The snowman bulks up with each snowball added to it.
meanings.sent4: The city bulks up with tourists during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The tree bulks up with leaves in the spring.

meanings.sent1: The superhero bulks up before facing the villain.
meanings.sent2: The building bulks up against the skyline.
meanings.sent3: The cake bulks up with layers of frosting.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds bulks up before the rain pours down.
meanings.sent5: The athlete bulks up with determination before the race.
